column5: I've been poking around the internet looking for any information or references on where to fish with my 10 year old grandson when we go to Cedar Lake, Cedar Point Resort at the end of July. I've found a number of references to"The Peephole". Anyone have any idea where this is? East arm, west arm?
Peep hole is on the south end of the east arm, it is called red water bay on this map.http://nebula.wsimg.com/8fbc22112850...&alloworigin=1
If you go to cedar point resorts Web site and than go to map and enlarge it. Peep hole is down on the bottom right. It's good fishing earlly season and late season.
Its also really good in the winter.lol.

Ol'Peehole man there alot of great spots to fish down there! Just go slow when going in it gets pretty shallow and watch out for the old man of the sea floating down there he may put a dent in the rig if you run him over!
Nitro man is right it gets shallow going in there. Caught lots of crappies last August down in that area. They were deep!
